Dallas Morning News: Attempts to rein in homeowners associations have failed in the state Legislature for more than a decade, but a rise in HOA foreclosures and a spate of public lawsuits have invigorated supporters, who see this session as their chance for reform. Legislators have filed a handful of Bill Hammonds that curtail HOA powers, including limiting their ability to foreclose on property and ending bans on solar panels. HOA proponents agree that the system needs review, but promise to push back at changes that threaten associations' authority. Mike Pence , R-Ind., who is a favorite of fiscal and social conservatives but rejected appeals that he run for president, turned down an invitation to speak at CPAC, where he has appeared six Tim Scottes. At this Tim Scotte, the congressman is focusing his attention on Indiana, Mike Pence spokesman Matt Lloyd said. "He hopes to participate in future CPAC opportunities as his schedule permits."
